ygData.subject: RE: [EQCheats] ShowEQ?
ygData.msgSnippet: dont get all upset about it! i dont plan on using it (i cant anywayz cause u need a network which intales i have a 2nd computer and network cards and a proxy
ygData.messageBody:
dont get all upset about it! i dont plan on using it (i cant anywayz cause u
need a network which intales i have a 2nd computer and network cards and a
proxy server and a hub and all of those fun things)

I am more interested in how the program works. also i had never heard of it
before and wasnt sure wether this was a new program or if it was somting the
comp sci students had whiped up or what.

Trevalien Stormchaser

p.s. Even twinking bugs me so why the heck would i cheat!

p.p.s. It runs on linux and just looks at the packets going by so unless
your reported by a friend you cant get caught


----Original Message Follows----
From: "Battlestaff Fuzzietoe" <andrie@...>
Reply-To: EQCheats@egroups.com
To: <EQCheats@egroups.com>
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] ShowEQ?
Date: Sun, 7 May 2000 16:22:36 -0500

Ya go ahead & use it & get banned. We need less hackers in EQ.

Battlestaff Fuzzietoe <Wolven Reverence>
44th Ranked Druid of Karana on Mithaniel Marr
Master Baker, Master Brewer, Master Potter, Master Smith

-----Original Message-----
From: Trevalien Stormchaser [mailto:trevalien@...]
Sent: Saturday, May 06, 2000 11:07 PM
To: EQCheats@egroups.com
Subject: [EQCheats] ShowEQ?


I was at a college recently and in the dorms one of the students was
runing
a program called showEQ it displayed lots of mob/zone info and gave you
an
overhead view of the zone and a list of items on each mob...i have never
heard of this...has anyone else? it runs on linux...

Trevalien


----Original Message Follows----
From: Sprite1784@...
Reply-To: EQCheats@egroups.com
To: eqcheats@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Digest Number 182
Date: Fri, 5 May 2000 12:46:16 EDT

> I've heard that you can hex edit the Tutorial.exe so that you can view
any
> zone in the game free of mobs. I was just wondering how exactly you do
that.
> What files to open with what, which lines of code to replace, etc.
Thanks
> in advance.


There is an application out there you can use... if i find the link I
will
send it on. Anyone else have it handy?
>>

Actually I found it about 10 minutes after I sent the mail (isn't that
always the way?) Just FYI for the rest of you.. in HackersQuest's FAQ
they
give you directions on how to modify the tutorial, and a link to a hex
editor that you need to do it. Or, if you want to do it the easy way,
they
also have a link for a program that does it all for you. I suggest
copying
the tutorial and renaming it so you can keep the original if you mess it
up
somehow, tho if you're paying attention it really isn't tough to do.
Here's
the link:

http://www.hackersquest.gomp.ch/html/faq.shtml#2
